definition: to start learning as a poet/to write one's first (poem, essay etc)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: He has been preparing for this long novel and has finally started to write it.
sentences.chinese: 他准备了很长时间的这部长篇小说，终于开笔了。

definition: to trace over red characters (as a method of learning to write)
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
to put pen to paper/pen mark
Spring Festival couplet (the first line of which is pasted on the right side of a doorway at New Year, and the second on the left side)
to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
to practice calligraphy from a model
remuneration for literary or artistic work
to take up one's pen/to start to write
generic term for hard writing instruments such as quill pens, fountain pens, ball pens and pencils, as opposed to writing brushes
to put down the pen/to stop writing
